text: Bernard Laidebeur (11 July 1942 - 21 April 1991) was a French athlete, who mainly competed in the 100 metres. He was born and died in Paris. He competed for France at the 1964 Summer Olympics held in Tokyo, Japan, where he won the bronze medal with his team mates Paul Genevay, Claude Piquemal and Jocelyn Delecour in the men's 4 x 100 metre relay. ==References== * Category:1942 births Category:1991 deaths Category:French male sprinters Category:Olympic bronze medalists for France Category:Athletes (track and field) at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic athletes of France Category:Sportspeople from Paris Category:Medalists at the 1964 Summer Olympics Category:Olympic bronze medalists in athletics (track and field)
title: Bernard Laidebeur
